frameDefinitions: A Cognizer construes an Item as belonging to a certain Category.
A Cognizer makes a judgment about an Evaluee.
A Cognizer has a Judgment of an Evaluee, expressing how high or low their regard for the Evaluee is.
A Whole, an entity with a substructure, is assessed for whether or not it has all the necessary parts that are defined for it or for an entity of its kind.
This frame contains words that describe how potent a chemical is.
A Container  is in a state of fullness/emptiness with respect to some Contents.
frameExamples: You 've already <t>stereotyped</t> me as a bimbo, have n't you?
JUDGMENT:  She <t>admired</t> Einstein for his character.
What do you <t>think</t> of him as a linguist?
What happens after the PPB investigation is <t>complete</t>?
John carried a bucket <t>full</t> of water.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument.
This is the entity which is construed or treated by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as an Object.

This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.

This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> role is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>:
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the judgment. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the one that makes a <fen>Judgment</fen>. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
<fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person or thing that a judgment is made with respect to. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
A description (from the point of view of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>) of the position of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on a scale of approval.
The entity that is being assessed for having all its necessary parts or not.
The interval of time when the completeness of the entity is assessed.
The entity for which potency is being evaluated.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the potency from the norm expressed by the target LU.
The time during which the <fen>Chemical_entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular potency.
The location where the <fen>Chemical_entity</fen> has the ascribed potency.
<fen>Container</fen> is used for the entity whose fullness is being described.
<fen>Contents</fen> is used for the stuff that is present/absent in the <fen>Container</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Container</fen> is full.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Kim</fex> categorized the books under fiction. <fex>Kim</fex> categorized them on the basis of genre.
The students were categorized <fex>on the basis of their test scores</fex>.
<fex>20 years ago</fex> people would consider this as nothing unusual
<fex>The boss</fex> appreciates you for your diligence.
The boss appreciates <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
She viewed him with an appreciative <fex>gaze</fex>.
<fex>The boss</fex> appreciates you for your diligence.
I hold him in the <fex>highest</fex> esteem.
<fex>Our list of participants</fex> is still incomplete.
My journey to the dark side is <fex>now</fex> complete.

the Armed Forces of the Philippines

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The South China Sea Arbitration: Settlement of Disputes
